cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 420 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northeast, make landfall across Florida’s Big Bend, then accelerate northeastward across GA/SC/NC and move offshore of the Mid-Atlantic toward the open western Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (between Anclote River and Indian Pass)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anclote River to Indian Pass, FL; Tropical Storm Watch west of Indian Pass to the Walton/Bay County line, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of Florida Big Bend Thursday, then Atlantic coast from northern Florida through the Carolinas and offshore Mid-Atlantic by the weekend
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤9%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts to 25–35 mph possible late Saturday/Sunday if the center tracks closer.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Delaware River or Delaware Bay from Hermine under current track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain possible late Saturday into Sunday, generally 1–2 inches with locally higher amounts if rain bands pivot inland.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf and dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey and Delaware beaches during the holiday weekend.
